sense.name: a trodden foot route, used for pedestrian travel
sense.commentary: PATHWAY[+structure][+physical][+route][+pedestrian][+trodden] Note: refers to a usable, demarcated foot route
sense.examples: We followed a pathway through the woods to an old cabin. It was a hidden underground pathway used by royalty for escape.

sense.name: a chain of nerve cells that can transmit electrical impulses
sense.commentary: PATHWAY[+structure][+physical][+anatomical][+chain][+cell][+nerve] Note: refers to component neural structures of the nervous system anatomy.
sense.examples: The accident severed the neural pathway from the lower spine to the brain. The brain contains very large and complex pathways of neurons.

sense.name: a chain of enzyme_induced chemical reactions
sense.commentary: PATHWAY[+event][+sequence][+reaction][+chemical][+enzyme_induced] Note: refers to a series of events
sense.examples: These metabolic pathways are not yet well understood by biochemists. He is studying the metabolic pathways involved in converting starches into sugars.
